oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bob Wills interview - Buck Wayne
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Bob Wills (performer), conducted by Buck Wayne.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Buck Wayne introduces Bob Wills -- Bob Wills talks about the numerous musicians in his family who influenced him growing up -- Wills talks about playing music with his family -- Wills talks about Jimmy Davis and being a minstrel comedian -- Wills talks about working with a number of musicians -- Wills talks about playing with Milton Brown and the Skillet Lickers -- Wills talks about playing anything people could dance to, no matter the genre -- Wills talks about his style of western swing music -- Wills talks about the future of western swing music -- Wills talks about younger audiences -- Wills talks about truly liking all music, including rock and roll -- Wills talks about older audiences being left out in terms of music played on the radio -- Wills talks about pandering to all ages and audiences -- Wills confirms that he has indeed stolen a watermelon -- Buck Wayne concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wills, Bob, 1905-1975;
